meanings.definition: A person who denies something, especially the existence of climate change.
meanings.sent1: Some deniers claim that climate change is not real.
meanings.sent2: The deniers at the meeting argued against the scientific evidence.
meanings.sent3: The deniers at the party refused to believe it was raining outside.
meanings.sent4: She was a denier of all things related to modern technology.
meanings.sent5: The deniers in the group were adamant in their disbelief.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight in the metric system equal to one tenth of a gram.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for just a few deniers of salt.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler measured the gemstone in deniers for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: He added a denier of flour to the mixture for thickness.
meanings.sent4: The scale showed the weight as two deniers.
meanings.sent5: The denier of gold was carefully weighed for the jewelry piece.

meanings.definition: A person who refuses to acknowledge or accept something.
meanings.sent1: The deniers of the new policy voiced their concerns.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a denier of any criticism directed at her.
meanings.sent3: The deniers of the truth were blind to the facts.
meanings.sent4: He acted like a denier of all responsibility in the matter.
meanings.sent5: The denier of reality lived in a world of illusions.
